name: O'Hanrahan

topics.response_text: It sure is nice to see everybody working together like family. Maybe now the baby Jesus won't cry his self to sleep every night.

topics.topic_text: How's that human niceness working out?
topics.response_text: Boy, the squad sure is working together a lot better now! I think we're gonna be A-Okay!

topics.topic_text: How'd you end up in the Army?
topics.response_text: Well, as it turns out, we had a string of bad harvests a few years back. Pa said he couldn't afford to feed but three youngins, or we'd starve.

topics.topic_text: What do you think of Camp Golf?
topics.response_text: Oh, it's a fine place. The lake is real{purty}pretty, and we don't get bothered much by them Legion fellers.

topics.topic_text: Why are you so afraid of fighting?
topics.response_text: I ain't scared! I just don't like hurting folks, is all. Ma always used to tell me "boy, you're the biggest and the strongest, so you mind yourself!"

topics.topic_text: Tell me a little more about yourself.
topics.response_text: Well, I was born on a farm out in California. Weren't much - me, Ma and Pa, my two sisters and about 40 acres of corn and brahmin.

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me about your squadmates?
topics.response_text: They're mostly pretty nice - Poindexter showed me how to make fireworks! Razz kinda scares me sometimes, but I don't mind. He's had a hard life.

topics.topic_text: Yes, it's true. I don't know why.
topics.response_text: Some folks just ain't cut out for Army life, I guess.

topics.topic_text: Yes, but it's a classified secret. Don't tell anybody.
Yes. He was sabotaging the Army to force the NCR to go home.
topics.response_text: Well that don't make no sense. We came all this way; why don't he want to stay? It's nice here.
That's right. Folks just don't talk to other folks, and everybody's always cross with each other.

topics.topic_text: That's the dumbest thing I've ever heard.
topics.response_text: Maybe you just ain't had a healthy dose of human niceness in a while.
Folks just don't talk to other folks, and everybody's always cross with each other.

topics.topic_text: So you think I should find ways to convince the Misfits to get along?
topics.response_text: That'd be swell. Only, if they knew the idea came from me, they probably wouldn't take you serious no more, so maybe you oughta think about it first.

topics.topic_text: Okay, I'll try to convince them.
On second thought, I'll ask around first.

description:
Private O'Hanrahan is a 23 year-old Caucasian Male.

A tall and physically imposing NCR soldier serving with the Misfits at Camp Golf. Despite his rugged appearance, Private O'Hanrahan is known among his squad for his gentle nature and reluctance to engage in unnecessary conflict.

Private O'Hanrahan's Personality: O'Hanrahan is a gentle giant at heart, possessing a natural aversion to violence despite his imposing stature. He is kind-hearted and empathetic, often trying to find peaceful solutions to problems. He values communication and camaraderie, believing that mutual respect and kindness are essential for unit cohesion. However, he is somewhat insecure about his straightforward personality, fearing that others might not take him seriously.

Private O'Hanrahan's Backstory: Born to a farming family in NCR territory, O'Hanrahan spent his early life working the family's 40-acre farm that primarily grew maize and raised brahmin. For years, the family managed to get by comfortably, but a series of bad harvests forced them to make difficult decisions. As the oldest child, O'Hanrahan was encouraged to join the NCR Army to help support his remaining family members. After basic training, he was deployed to the Mojave Wasteland as part of the Mojave Campaign, eventually assigned to Camp Golf with the Misfits.
